result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrell L. Johnston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*If probation revoked, huber priveleges for employment or any counseling he may be involved in 
*Entire sentence to be served in jail

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

*Submit DNA sample, if not already done so
*Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Eugene Rucinski, Ashely Norris and Anthony Oseman

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Brian Kane dated 10/12/16 in re:  request for JOC

Defendant Darrell L. Johnston in court with attorney Brian T. Kane. Defendant Darrell L. Johnston in custody.  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 16CM109 and 16CM172.

10:46 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CM109:
Count 1 - No contest 

16CM172:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - No contest 
Count 3 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has complied with victim notification; no victim's appear in Court today.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 16CM109 and Count 2 of 16CM172 and Count 1 & 3 of 16CM172 are DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kane makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
16CM109:
Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 60 day jail sentence - all to be served in jail
If probation revoked, huber priveleges for employment or counseling he may be involved in
1 day jail credit
Placed on Probation for 24 months:
**Conditions of Probation - 
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Eugene Rucinski, Ashley Norris and Anthony Oseman

16CM172:
Count 1 - DRI

Count 2 -
Impose/Stay 180 day jail sentence - concurrent with Count 1 in 16CM109
If probation revoked, huber priveleges for employment or counseling he may be involved in
First 90 days in jail 
Second 90 days could be served on GPS Electronic Home Monitoring if approved by jail administration and risk assessment
49 days jail credit if probation revoked
Placed on Probation for 24 months - concurrent to Count 1 in 16CM109
**Conditions of Probation - 
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Comply with conditions in Count 1 of 16CM109

Count 3 - DRI

20 days to appeal

Defendant Darrell L. Johnston in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:38 p.m.  Court calls case.

Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

**Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today.

BY THE COURT: 
Court enters NG plea on defendants behalf.  
Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.
